quote.#tail:
to clarify the rules of the District of Columbia regarding human occupancy of penthouses above the
			 top story of the building upon which the penthouse is placed.
quote.#text: An Act to regulate the height of buildings in the District of Columbia

committee-name.#text: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text: Clarification of rules applying to human occupancy of penthouses in district of columbia buildings

quote.#tail: , approved June 1, 1910 (sec. 6–601.05(h), D.C. Official Code) is amended by striking
quote.#text: An Act to regulate the height of buildings in the District of Columbia

and no floor or compartment thereof shall be constructed or used for human occupancy above the top
			 story of the building upon which such structures are placed

and, except in the case of a penthouse which is erected to a height of one story of 20 feet or less
			 above the level of the roof, no floor or compartment thereof shall be
			 constructed or used for human occupancy above the top story of the
			 building upon which such structures are placed

text.#text: The eighth paragraph of section 5 of the Act entitled

header.#text: Permitting Human Occupancy of Penthouses Within Certain Height Limit

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 4192 IH: To amend the Act entitled “An Act to regulate the height of buildings in the District of Columbia” to clarify the rules of the District of Columbia regarding human occupancy of penthouses above the top story of the building upon which the penthouse is placed.
